basics.name: Ramya Muthukrishnan
basics.label: PhD Student
basics.summary: PhD student at MIT CSAIL with a research focus on computer vision and medical imaging

work.name: MIT Lincoln Laboratory
highlights: SE(3)-equivariant neural networks and transformers for solving forward and inverse modeling problems in radar, respectively

work.name: Penn Center for Neuroengineering and Therapeutics
highlights: Automated segmentation in postsurgical epilepsy neuroimaging with neural networks
Automated extraction of seizure frequency from epilepsy clinic notes with BERT

work.name: Penn Center for Biomedical Image Computing and Analytics
highlights: Federated deep learning for quantitative breast density estimation in mammography

work.name: Expedition Technology
highlights: Contrastive self-supervised learning for 3D object detection in point clouds

work.name: University of Pennsylvania
highlights: Courses taught include machine learning, deep learning, data science, and capstone projects

awards.title: Best Departmental Masters Thesis

awards.summary: Thesis: Graph neural networks for scalable, real-world coverage control in distributed multi-robot systems
